info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 3 at 12:42PM EDT until April 10 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids MI
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Michigan...
Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County.
.Runoff from heavy rainfall that fell across Lower Michigan earlier this week will produce a crest on the Grand River near Comstock Park. Additional rainfall over the next few days will contribute to the river level rises. Comstock Park will rise to near or slightly above flood stage.
* WHAT...Flooding is possible.
* WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park.
* WHEN...From late Saturday night to Thursday, April 10.
* IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of homes along Abrigador Trail.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:24 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO THURSDAY, APRIL 10
